page.title: 09INDUSTRY IN HIGH WYCOMBE
page.content:
Before 1960{furniture}was the main industry of High Wycombe. This changed after the development of{industrial {estates}at Cressex and Sands. Firms cover a wide range of industrial development particularly{engineering and{electronics.}Due to it's accessibility to the M40, firms are attracted to the area and over 400 companies export products. The development of small industrial units is now common.
A century ago,{furniture production ruled supreme and contrasts greatly to today's industrial scene. Although furniture making is no longer the main industry, it still produces{12%}of all of the furniture made in the United Kingdom and{80%}of the country's output of chairs.
